intro: Oncostemum hieroglyforme, commonly known as the sacred lotus of ancient Egypt, is a flowering plant native to the Nile River region. It belongs to the family Nymphaeaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom on long, floating stems. The plant has broad, waxy leaves that remain above water, while its roots anchor in the muddy substrate. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with a distinctive central stigma that resembles a lotus flower. Oncostemum hieroglyforme was revered in ancient Egyptian culture and often depicted in religious art and iconography.
